trans-unit.source: Provides the system implementation for displaying a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService> class provides attached properties that can be used to specify the appearance and position of a context menu.
Many of the properties in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService> class are also defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu>.

Sometimes it is more convenient to set the properties by using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService> class than by setting the properties on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu>.

For example, you can create a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> to be shared by multiple elements, but use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService> class to specify a different position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> for each element.
The following properties are defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService> classes.

If any of these properties are set on both <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService>, the property value from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService> is used.
You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService> to display menus on disabled items.
Adds a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.ContextMenuClosing"></xref> attached event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that listens to this event.
The event handler to be added.
Adds a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.ContextMenuOpening"></xref> attached event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that listens to this event.
The event handler to be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.ContextMenuClosing"></xref> routed event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.ContextMenuOpening"></xref> attached event.

Value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.ContextMenu"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref> has a drop shadow.
Object to query concerning whether it has a drop shadow.
A Boolean value, **true** if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref> has a drop shadow; **false** otherwise.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.HorizontalOffset"></xref> property of the specified object.

Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.PlacementTarget"></xref> property of the specified object.

Value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.PlacementTarget"></xref> property.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.ShowOnDisabled"></xref> property of the specified object.

Value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuService.ShowOnDisabled"></xref> property.
